main event: A civilian observed a round, silver object, the size of a pea or a little smaller than a basketball, following a B-36 aircraft before stopping for a while and going straight up in Amarillo, Texas on July 9, 1957.
interesting points: The observed object was described as being round, silver, and the size of a pea or slightly smaller than a basketball.
It seemed to be following a B-36 aircraft before stopping and then ascending straight up.
Weather balloon was released near the time of the sighting, leading to speculation that the observed object could have been a balloon.
The weather and winds aloft conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with varying speeds at different altitudes.
The reporting officer and civilian Weather WX believed the object was a balloon.
